message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the properties of wood. Dry wood easily scorches when exposed to heat due to its flammable nature. Option (B) is incorrect because wood does not freeze. Option (C) is incorrect because evaporation refers to the process of liquid turning into vapor, which is not relevant to wood. Option (D) is incorrect because wood does not melt.

This question requires basic knowledge about the properties of wood and how it reacts under different conditions. Dry wood easily scorches because it is highly flammable and can catch fire when exposed to heat or flames. Option (B) is incorrect because wood does not freeze, as freezing is a process that involves the transformation of liquid into solid. Option (C) is incorrect because wood does not evaporate, as evaporation is a process that involves the transformation of liquid into gas. Option (D) is incorrect because wood does not melt, as melting is a process that involves the transformation of solid into liquid.

This question requires knowledge about the characteristics of dry wood. Dry wood is highly flammable and therefore easily scorches when exposed to heat or fire. Option (C) is incorrect because evaporation refers to the process of liquid turning into gas and is not related to wood. Option (D) is incorrect because melting refers to the change of a solid into a liquid and is also not applicable to wood.
